messages.subject: Earrrings
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/17/2003 8:09:56 PM Central Standard Time, ... T.J. Maxx has great prices on gold earrings. Here s another thought: see if you can buy just
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/17/2003 8:09:56 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

>
> WalMart used to stock some decent 14K earings for pretty cheap, maybe they
> still do. Can she borrow some from you or another grown relative to try
> before she spends her money? (Cleaning them well first, of course.)

T.J. Maxx has great prices on gold earrings.

Here's another thought: see if you can buy just the *wires* in gold--from
an earring or bead or craft-supply store--and then re-string (well,
whatever...re-wire? re-bead?) her favorite earrings onto the new, gold
wires.

My dh has such odd, corrosive skin that he's even eaten away the
inscriptions inside his fat, gold wedding band--after only 22 years of
marriage. ;-)

Becky In Iowa



"To announce that there must be no criticism of the president, or that we are
to stand by the president right or wrong, is not only unpatriotic and
servile, but is morally treasonable to the American public."
--Theodore Roosevelt


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
